BodyName: Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Location: HYBRID HEARING - Council Chambers - City Hall

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a report on the provision of medical services related to reproductive health care
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Report on the provision of medical services related to reproductive health care.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the use of city resources to enforce abortion restrictions
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the use of city resources to enforce abortion restrictions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a cause of action related to interference with reproductive or endocrine medical care
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Cause of action related to interference with reproductive or endocrine medical care.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to make medication abortion available at no cost to a patient at its health clinics
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to make medication abortion available at no cost to a patient at its health clinics.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, The Reproductive Freedom and Equity Program (S.9078/A.10148A), which would establish a grant program to provide funding to New York abortion providers and non-profit organizations to increase access to abortion care
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: The Reproductive Freedom and Equity Program (S.9078/A.10148A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.9137/A.10356, which would allow out-of-state physicians to provide reproductive health services in this state while awaiting full licensure.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Allow out-of-state physicians to provide reproductive health services in this state while awaiting full licensure. (S.9137/A.10356)

Items.Title: Resolution declaring New York City a safe city for all those in need of abortion-related care
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Declaring New York City a safe city for all those in need of abortion-related care.

Items.Title: Resolution declaring January 22, 2023 as Roe v. Wade Day in the City of New York to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the landmark United States Supreme Court decision.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Declaring January 22, 2023 as Roe v. Wade Day in the City of New York to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the landmark United States Supreme Court decision.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Senate to pass and the President to sign the Women’s Health Protection Act
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: United States Senate to pass and the President to sign the Women’s Health Protection Act.
